Topic.Title: Do You Think KO is a BUY, SELL, or HOLD?

Message.Msg: Fantastic. I will check it out.

Message.Title: BCCI--COFFEE HEADING NORTH TO$1.00 HUGE UPSIDE

Message.Msg: ********* VIRUS ALERT *********** DO NOT FOLLOW LINK!
Bump! Don't click on "KO Insider Trading."

Cramer consistently keeps people out of blue chip dividend stocks at their lows--then tells people to buy 10% up (and often MUCH HIGHER near their 52 week highs.) I wish I had $5 for every time Cramer has said "Don't buy," right after I bought what I saw as a really good price--and then, said, "Buy, buy, buy," right after I took profits. Guess what? He does it with the Charitable Trust stocks, too. You get a message that he bought near the 52 week high--and you are scratching your head that he is buying up there--A FEW DAYS later, he sells the position. Well, figure it out. Cramer knows he can move the market. So he gooses the stock when he thinks it is running out of steam. Stock moves higher, but comes back down--now he knows near term upside is capped. He sells, and pats himself on the back. Meanwhile, the folks watching Mad Money who bought the latest pump are stuck with dead money at best and more likely, a declining share price. Make your own decisions. You never know the motives behind investment advice.

Remember when Cramer put JNJ's Ceo on the "Wall of Shame?" That was when JNJ hit around $61 back in 2012. Thankfully, I bought before that happened. Anyone paying attention would know that Cramer was screaming, "buy, buy, buy" around $67-$68 a share. Maybe he is just that stupid, but it is hard not to be cynical.
******* VIRUS ALERT ************ DO NOT FOLLOW LINK!
When NAT bought its 15th tanker Cramer said to buy at 35. Now its at 9 and change. He still has the Norskie CEO on pumping like crazy.
